comment.text: DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates.
Resistance to the antibiotics salinamide A, salinamide B, rifampicin, streptolydigin, CBR703, myxopyronin, and lipiarmycin can result from mutations in this protein.
The RNAP catalytic core consists of 2 alpha, 1 beta, 1 beta' and 1 omega subunit. When a sigma factor is associated with the core the holoenzyme is formed, which can initiate transcription.
Acetylated on several lysine residues in the presence of glucose.
Co-administration of salinamide and rifampicin or salinamide and myxopyronin suppresses the emergence of resistance to both antibiotics.
Belongs to the RNA polymerase beta chain family.

feature.description: Resistant to antibiotics salinamide A and B.
